revised_title: Atomic Wave Functions: Results for Be, Ca, and Hg
tldr: This article presents the results of calculations of atomic wave functions for the elements Be, Ca, and Hg using the self-consistent field method. The authors discuss the effects of the valence electrons on the atomic core and the perturbation of the core by the valence electrons. They also compare their results with the Thomas-Fermi field and highlight the challenges of applying the self-consistent field method to heavy elements like Hg.
